executive_summary: An aging population has supported the Disability Insurance industry over the last five years. Despite higher awareness of the seriousness of disabilities, rising national unemployment has hindered industry revenue. In addition, the pandemic resulted in a double-digit revenue decline in 2020. The pandemic produced a severe economic contraction and a record spike in unemployment, resulting in a single-year revenue decline of 10.6% in 2020.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: An older population limits declines as rising unemployment drags down revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Older individuals purchase disability insurance at higher rates as they're more at risk of serious injury. In the last five years, the median age of population increased in the United States. Disability insurance helps older adults ensure their long-term financial stability to retire. In addition, the growth in the median age of the population has contributed to limiting revenue declines.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE COVID PANDEMIC DISRUPTED EMPLOYMENT LEVELS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for disability insurance depends on employment levels; In other words, when unemployment rises, demand for disability insurance declines. Disability insurance revenue dropped by 10.6% in 2020 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: RISING INTEREST RATES PROVIDE A MODEST LIFELINE FOR THE INDUSTRY
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Higher interest rates are increasing the returns from fixed-income securities such as bonds. This has helped limit industry revenue declines over the past five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: GENERATING AWARENESS FOR DISABILITY INSURANCE WILL SUSTAIN REVENUE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: There is a great deal of room for expansion in the employer-sponsored disability insurance market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Disability Insurers Will Benefit From A Wider Market
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Greater market penetration will create a more varied pool of policyholders.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Bond Investment Conditions Will Likely Stay Strong For Insurers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Federal Reserve is committed to controlling high inflation and will continue to keep interest rates elevated.

industry_definition: This industry underwrites (i.e. assuming the risk and assigning premiums) disability insurance policies.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - steady

key_trends: Operators that can expand their operations can achieve economies of scale faster.
Growth in the number of businesses during the outlook period will support industry revenue growth.
An aging population proved to be beneficial for the industry over the last five years.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Some individuals whose employers don't offer disability insurance, personally purchase disability insurance.
Businesses can cover their employee's disability insurance at a lower price than if each employee purchased their own policy individually.

products_and_services.product_description: Individual disability policies are generally offered in two forms: noncancelable and guaranteed renewable.
Group disability insurance policies are provided on a short and long-term basis.
Investment income is revenue earned through investment activities.

tier_1_suppliers: Life Insurance & Annuities in the US
Health & Medical Insurance in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The size of the workforce determines the number of people who have access to employer-sponsored disability programs.

business_locations.location_description: The high concentration of insurers is due to the large population levels in the region.
Insurance companies tend to be in areas with a higher concentration of the financial services sector.
The Great Lakes are the region with the third largest amount of industry establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Insurance companies are primarily subject to regulation and supervision by the states in which they transact.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The NAIC is an association of state regulators, continually reexamines existing laws and regulations.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Operators must comply with capital and regulation requirements.
New entrants require upfront capital to run operations.
This industry is very competitive in pricing.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators that can expand their operations can achieve economies of scale faster.
Growth in the number of businesses during the outlook period will support industry revenue growth.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Operators that can expand operations can achieve economies of scale faster.
Insurers that can't achieve economies of scale will merge with larger operators.

top_companies.company_name: The Hartford Financial Services Group, Inc.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: THE IMPORTANCE OF LABOR LIMITS DECLINES IN WAGES
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages have declined slightly over the past five years.

FAQs.question: How diversified are your product offerings compared to competitors?
FAQs.answer: The types of disability insurance offered by any one insurer varies significantly.

FAQs.question: What media channels are you using to attract consumers and investors, if any?
FAQs.answer: Most disability insurers advertise their services via television.

FAQs.question: Does your company have exposure to fintech competitors? How is it effecting your strategy moving forward?
FAQs.answer: Disability insurers have limited exposure to fintech competitors.
